Levin Güver
About Research Teaching CV

Hey there – thanks for visiting my website! My name is Levin Güver and I hold a Bachelor of Law and Master of Law (summa cum laude) from the University of Zurich, where I was fortunate enough to graduate as valedictorian. I am jointly appointed as a research assistance at both the Law Faculty and the Philosophy Faculty. I am an SNSF funded member of the Reading Guilty Minds group.

My main interests lie in legal philosophy, where I am most passionate about the philosophical foundations underlying the criminal law. I am also interested in action theory and occasionally dabble in neuroethics. In my free time I enjoy going to the gym, reading, and playing chess.

Do not hesitate to message me if there are any questions as concerns my research and teaching, or my CV. :-)
